MultiSwiss

Class MultiSwiss

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.AbstractComponent
      • core.AbstractRanking
        • MultiSwiss.MultiSwiss

  • public class MultiSwiss
extends AbstractRanking
    This ranking method is for evaluating a candidate pool using competitive multi-player games It applies a Swiss-style pairing system as described in https://www.wizards.com/dci/downloads/RISK2210Swiss.pdf
    Author:
    wilfried

    • Method Detail

      • sortCandidates

        public int sortCandidates(java.util.ArrayList<AbstractRepresentation> pop,
                          ProblemXMLData problem,
                          NESRandom random)
        Sorts the given array of representations in a descending order of fitness and returns the number of evaluation that was required for the ranking to finish. Evaluation of the candidates is done by the provided problem component.
        Specified by:
        sortCandidates in class AbstractRanking
        Parameters:
        representations - The population to be sorted.
        problem - The problem descriptor to be used for evaluation.
        random - The random generator object used for sorting.
        Returns:
        the number of evaluations that were needed to rank the given set of representations

        utility function to pause the program for debug purposes
